title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) earned: For the lamp correctly positioned 55 cm from the converging lens

1 point(s) earned: For the screen correctly positioned 21.3 cm from the lens, on the opposite side from the lamp
descriptions:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) earned: For indicating a valid pair of quantities that would lead to a linear graph from which the focal length could be determined

1 point(s) earned: For justifying the choice of quantities, either by indicating how to use the slope or intercept of the line to determine the focal length or by indicating how the lens equation yields a linear function

1 point(s) earned: For calculating data for the table, with at least three correct pairs of numbers

Table below shows data for two possibilities: 1/s0 and 1/s1 ; s0s1 and s0 + s1

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Part i

1 point(s) earned: For the axes scaled linearly and labeled with units for plotted quantities (even if the wrong quantities are plotted), such that the plot uses at least half of the axes

1 point(s) earned: For correctly plotting the data listed in the part (b) table

The following graphs show the two possibilities noted above.

 

Part ii

1 point(s) earned: For drawing a straight best-fit line accurately through the data (data points evenly distributed about the line and representing the trend of the data)

1 point(s) earned: For accurately calculating the slope or intercept using the graph (depending on quantities plotted) and relating it to the focal length

1 point(s) earned: For the first graph (1/s1 as a function of 1/s0):

From the lens equation 1 s i = 1 f = 1 s 0 , s o 1 f equals the intercept of the 1/si axis

1/f = 0.066 cm-1

f = 15.2 cm

For the first graph (1/s1 as a function of 1/s0):

The lens equation can be rearranged as s0si = f(s0 + si), so f equals the slope

f = ( 1170 − 970 ) c m 2 ( 75.5 − 62.5 ) c m = 200 13 c m

f = 15.4 cm

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) earned: For drawing and labeling the lamp, screen, and converging mirror at positions that will create a real image

1 point(s) earned: For describing appropriate measurements

1 point(s) earned: For describing a calculation of the focal length that correctly uses the measurements

Example: Place the lamp between 15 and 30 cm from the mirror. Place the screen on the other side of the lamp from the mirror, adjusting its position until the clearest image is formed. Measure the distance of the lamp and screen from the mirror. Use the equation (1/si) + (1/s0) = (1/f) to calculate the focal length
